references_text: Blessed with beautiful beaches and warm, sunny weather, this outback coastal town is a mecca for outdoor water activities. Swimmin...
references_markdown:
![Visiting Cape Leveque & Dampier Peninsula, WA](https://api.dataforseo.com/cdn/i/11280102-6179-0139-0000-11daa74aaf0f:4)
In Dampier, you can `explore Murujuga National Park to see the world's largest collection of petroglyphs, relax on the Dampier Foreshore by visiting beaches like Shark Cage Beach, and see the famous Red Dog statue`.Other activities include enjoying water sports in the [Dampier Archipelago](https://www.google.com/search?sca_esv=90eb1434918bedd4&hl=en&gl=AU&q=Dampier+Archipelago&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjv_uibuJORAxVdSjABHZKRHnEQxccNegQIOBAB), which offers world-class fishing, boating, diving, and snorkeling opportunities.You can also visit the [North West Shelf Visitors Centre](https://www.google.com/search?sca_esv=90eb1434918bedd4&hl=en&gl=AU&q=North+West+Shelf+Visitors+Centre&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjv_uibuJORAxVdSjABHZKRHnEQxccNegQIOhAB) or take day trips to nearby attractions like the [Hearson's Cove](https://www.google.com/search?sca_esv=90eb1434918bedd4&hl=en&gl=AU&q=Hearson%27s+Cove&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjv_uibuJORAxVdSjABHZKRHnEQxccNegQIOhAC) or the [Yaburara Heritage Trail](https://www.google.com/search?sca_esv=90eb1434918bedd4&hl=en&gl=AU&q=Yaburara+Heritage+Trail&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjv_uibuJORAxVdSjABHZKRHnEQxccNegQIOhAD).  
[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Blessed%20with%20beautiful%20beaches%20and,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=The%20massive%20gorges%2C%20crystal%20clear,to%20the%20Moon%2C%20is%20extraordinary.)[[3]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)[[4]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/dampier-foreshore/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Foreshore%20offers%20shaded,a%20couple%20of%20hours%20relaxing.)[[5]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)[[6]](https://dampierseafarers.org/history/dampier/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20area%20is%20home,animals%2C%20animal%20tracks%20and%20symbols.)

Outdoor activities

- **Explore Murujuga National Park:** Visit the ancient rock art petroglyphs, a must-see attraction on the Burrup Peninsula.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)[[2]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/history/dampier/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20area%20is%20home,animals%2C%20animal%20tracks%20and%20symbols.)
- **Relax at Dampier Foreshore:** Walk along the palm-lined Esplanade, have a picnic, and swim at Shark Cage Beach or Hampton Harbour Beach.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/dampier-foreshore/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Foreshore%20offers%20shaded,a%20couple%20of%20hours%20relaxing.)
- **Go boating and fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago and nearby Mackerel Islands are known for excellent boating, fishing, diving, and snorkeling.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Blessed%20with%20beautiful%20beaches%20and,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=The%20massive%20gorges%2C%20crystal%20clear,to%20the%20Moon%2C%20is%20extraordinary.)
- **Visit Hearson's Cove:** Take a short drive from Karratha to see this scenic coastal spot.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)
- **Walk the Yaburara Heritage Trail:** Learn about the local history and enjoy the landscape.
- **See the Red Dog statue:** Take a photo with the bronze statue dedicated to the famous Australian legend.[[1]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)

Cultural and visitor experiences

- **Discover the North West Shelf:** Visit the North West Shelf Visitors Centre to learn about the region.
- **Explore the Dampier Archipelago:** Book an experience with a local company to find secluded bays or go on a snorkeling or swimming tour.[[1]](https://www.facebook.com/lethaladventures/videos/the-dampier-archipelago-like-youve-never-seen-itthis-reel-shows-just-a-glimpse-o/1208846087635735/)
- **Visit Cygnet Bay Pearl Farm:** See what the region's famous pearl farming industry is all about.[[1]](https://www.waholidayguide.com.au/explore-wa/north-west-western-australia/north-west-region-guide/dampier-peninsula-western-australia#:~:text=Cygnet%20Bay%20Pearl%20Farm.%20The%20Dampier%20Peninsula,pearl%20farm%20in%20Australia%20at%20Cygnet%20Bay.)
- **Experience the Staircase to the Moon:** Time your visit to witness this natural seasonal phenomenon.[[1]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=The%20massive%20gorges%2C%20crystal%20clear,to%20the%20Moon%2C%20is%20extraordinary.)

[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Blessed%20with%20beautiful%20beaches%20and,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=The%20massive%20gorges%2C%20crystal%20clear,to%20the%20Moon%2C%20is%20extraordinary.)[[3]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)[[4]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/dampier-foreshore/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Foreshore%20offers%20shaded,a%20couple%20of%20hours%20relaxing.)[[5]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)[[6]](https://dampierseafarers.org/history/dampier/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20area%20is%20home,animals%2C%20animal%20tracks%20and%20symbols.)

Outdoor activities

- **Explore Murujuga National Park:** Visit the ancient rock art petroglyphs, a must-see attraction on the Burrup Peninsula.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)[[2]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/history/dampier/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20area%20is%20home,animals%2C%20animal%20tracks%20and%20symbols.)
- **Relax at Dampier Foreshore:** Walk along the palm-lined Esplanade, have a picnic, and swim at Shark Cage Beach or Hampton Harbour Beach.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/dampier-foreshore/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Foreshore%20offers%20shaded,a%20couple%20of%20hours%20relaxing.)
- **Go boating and fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago and nearby Mackerel Islands are known for excellent boating, fishing, diving, and snorkeling.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Blessed%20with%20beautiful%20beaches%20and,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=The%20massive%20gorges%2C%20crystal%20clear,to%20the%20Moon%2C%20is%20extraordinary.)
- **Visit Hearson's Cove:** Take a short drive from Karratha to see this scenic coastal spot.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)
- **Walk the Yaburara Heritage Trail:** Learn about the local history and enjoy the landscape.
- **See the Red Dog statue:** Take a photo with the bronze statue dedicated to the famous Australian legend.[[1]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)

Cultural and visitor experiences

- **Discover the North West Shelf:** Visit the North West Shelf Visitors Centre to learn about the region.
- **Explore the Dampier Archipelago:** Book an experience with a local company to find secluded bays or go on a snorkeling or swimming tour.[[1]](https://www.facebook.com/lethaladventures/videos/the-dampier-archipelago-like-youve-never-seen-itthis-reel-shows-just-a-glimpse-o/1208846087635735/)
- **Visit Cygnet Bay Pearl Farm:** See what the region's famous pearl farming industry is all about.[[1]](https://www.waholidayguide.com.au/explore-wa/north-west-western-australia/north-west-region-guide/dampier-peninsula-western-australia#:~:text=Cygnet%20Bay%20Pearl%20Farm.%20The%20Dampier%20Peninsula,pearl%20farm%20in%20Australia%20at%20Cygnet%20Bay.)
- **Experience the Staircase to the Moon:** Time your visit to witness this natural seasonal phenomenon.[[1]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=The%20massive%20gorges%2C%20crystal%20clear,to%20the%20Moon%2C%20is%20extraordinary.)

references_markdown:
- **Explore Murujuga National Park:** Visit the ancient rock art petroglyphs, a must-see attraction on the Burrup Peninsula.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)[[2]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/history/dampier/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20area%20is%20home,animals%2C%20animal%20tracks%20and%20symbols.)
- **Relax at Dampier Foreshore:** Walk along the palm-lined Esplanade, have a picnic, and swim at Shark Cage Beach or Hampton Harbour Beach.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/dampier-foreshore/#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Foreshore%20offers%20shaded,a%20couple%20of%20hours%20relaxing.)
- **Go boating and fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago and nearby Mackerel Islands are known for excellent boating, fishing, diving, and snorkeling.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Blessed%20with%20beautiful%20beaches%20and,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=The%20massive%20gorges%2C%20crystal%20clear,to%20the%20Moon%2C%20is%20extraordinary.)
- **Visit Hearson's Cove:** Take a short drive from Karratha to see this scenic coastal spot.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/karratha/#:~:text=Karratha%20is%20the%20perfect%20base,the%20port%20town%20of%20Dampier.)
- **Walk the Yaburara Heritage Trail:** Learn about the local history and enjoy the landscape.
- **See the Red Dog statue:** Take a photo with the bronze statue dedicated to the famous Australian legend.[[1]](https://www.outlooktraveller.com/destinations/international/did-you-know-about-pilbara-among-the-oldest-places-on-earth#:~:text=Another%20must-see%20attraction%20is%20the%20Murujuga%20National,the%20town%20which%20travellers%20must%20not%20miss.)

ai_mode_summary:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

See more

Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

See the massive mining operations[[1]](https://www.droversway.com.au/experiences/history-heritage#:~:text=Explore%20the%20Kapunda%20Historic%20Mine%20Walk%20and,ingenuity%20and%20determination%20of%20the%20early%20settlers.)

- **Dampier Port Tour:** Take a bus tour hosted by the **Mission to Seafarers** to get a behind-the-scenes look at the massive iron ore and salt export operations at the Dampier ports, as well as the [Dampier Salt mine](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11f01qbj9r&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIDRAD).
- **[North West Shelf Visitor Centre](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11dzt1852v&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIDRAG):** Learn about the massive offshore natural gas operation with an interactive virtual tour.[[1]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)[[2]](https://destinationpilbara.com.au/features/tours/dampier-port-tour#:~:text=Learn%20about%20the%20Dampier%20Seafarers,Features)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/itineraries/discover-dampier/#:~:text=This%20morning%20head%20out%20to,dates%20of%20occurrence%20click%20here.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)

Things to note before you go

- **Protect the culture:** When visiting [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIEhAC) , stick to designated pathways to avoid damaging the ancient rock art.
- **Observe wildlife:** Drive carefully in the Dampier area, especially at dawn and dusk, as kangaroos are active.[[1]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_text: * ABOUT DAMPIER. Located in the Pilbara region of Western Australia, the town of Dampier is about a 20 km drive north west of Karr...
references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

---

See more

Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

See more

Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

- **Dampier Port Tour:** Take a bus tour hosted by the **Mission to Seafarers** to get a behind-the-scenes look at the massive iron ore and salt export operations at the Dampier ports, as well as the [Dampier Salt mine](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11f01qbj9r&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIDRAD).

Things to note before you go

- **Protect the culture:** When visiting [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIEhAC) , stick to designated pathways to avoid damaging the ancient rock art.
- **Observe wildlife:** Drive carefully in the Dampier area, especially at dawn and dusk, as kangaroos are active.[[1]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

references_text: Located just 20 kilometres west of Karratha, the pretty port town of Dampier is named after the English buccaneer Willi...
references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

---

See more

Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.

- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

Things to note before you go

- **Protect the culture:** When visiting [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIEhAC) , stick to designated pathways to avoid damaging the ancient rock art.
- **Observe wildlife:** Drive carefully in the Dampier area, especially at dawn and dusk, as kangaroos are active.[[1]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_text: Where to find Fishing and Charters * Fishing in the Dampier Archipelago. With a huge variety of fish species inhabiting the area i...
references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

- **Protect the culture:** When visiting [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIEhAC) , stick to designated pathways to avoid damaging the ancient rock art.
- **Observe wildlife:** Drive carefully in the Dampier area, especially at dawn and dusk, as kangaroos are active.[[1]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_text: Get behind the scenes. Join the Dampier Seafarers tour and learn about the Dampier Seafarers Centre and the Rio Tinto mining opera...
references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

See more

Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_text: Australia's North West is the only place in the world where you can witness this natural phenomenon, which occurs as the full moon...
references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

- **Observe wildlife:** Drive carefully in the Dampier area, especially at dawn and dusk, as kangaroos are active.[[1]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

- **Protect the culture:** When visiting [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIEhAC) , stick to designated pathways to avoid damaging the ancient rock art.
- **Observe wildlife:** Drive carefully in the Dampier area, especially at dawn and dusk, as kangaroos are active.[[1]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_text: Explore Dampier Archipelago. The Dampier Archipelago in the Pilbara region of WA is a coastal wonderland comprising of 42 islands ...
references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)

See more

Discover Indigenous culture and history

- **[Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAC):** Located on the Burrup Peninsula, this park contains one of the largest collections of Indigenous rock art in the world, with over 20,000 petroglyphs. You can join a ranger-led cultural experience at the Nganjarli rock art site.
- **Deep Gorge:** Also within [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBxAG) , this gorge contains numerous pieces of Aboriginal rock art that tell indigenous stories.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attractions-g495053-Activities-Dampier_The_Pilbara_Western_Australia.html#:~:text=1.,Day%20Trips)[[3]](https://www.australiangeographic.com.au/history-culture/2016/03/top-7-aboriginal-rock-art-sites/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%20Murujuga%20%28%20Burrup%20Peninsula,100%20Most%20Endangered%20Places%20in%20the%20World.)[[4]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[5]](https://www.smh.com.au/traveller/topic/indigenous-culture-1mx9#:~:text=It%20might%20be%20ancient%2C%20but%20the%20world's,watch%20the%20rock%2C%20the%20rock%20watches%20back.)

Visit local landmarks

- **[Red Dog Statue](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11bw1plsvk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAC):** Pay a visit to the iconic bronze statue of Red Dog, the famous Pilbara wanderer, located at the entrance to Dampier.
- **Roaming with Red Dog Trail:** Follow the signposted trail around Dampier to discover more about Red Dog's story.
- **[Dampier Foreshore](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11h1m9jh3z&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAH):** Take a stroll or have a picnic along the palm-lined foreshore, which offers beach access and shaded areas. The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

The adjacent **[Dampier Foreshore Playground](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11n8qqp7v_&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIChAJ)** is a great family-friendly option.
- **[Sam's Island](https://www.google.com/search?q=Sam's+Island&kgmid=/g/11bxf4by0c&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQ3egRegQIChAM):** Visit this historic island, a short distance from the foreshore, where Sam Ostojich built his own castle.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/explore/pilbara/dampier/#:~:text=our%20National%20Parks.-,Read%20More,Read%20More)[[3]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

Things to note before you go

- **Observe wildlife:** Drive carefully in the Dampier area, especially at dawn and dusk, as kangaroos are active.[[1]](https://www.dampier.org.au/new-index#:~:text=The%20Dampier%20Archipelago%20hosts%20a,the%20waters%20off%20the%20Archipelago.)

references_text: Pilbara Dive and Tours offers unforgettable marine adventures along the spectacular Pilbara coastline of Western Australia. Tour o...
references_markdown:
In Dampier, you can explore the 42 islands of the [Dampier Archipelago](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0g2329&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAD) , see ancient Indigenous rock art at [Murujuga National Park](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11cn9p05m9&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIAhAF) , and visit landmarks dedicated to the legendary dog Red Dog . You can also see the massive scale of the port and mining industry with a guided tour.[[1]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier/#:~:text=Just%2020%20kilometres%20from%20Karratha,enjoyed%20here%20all%20year%20round.)[[2]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[3]](https://dampierseafarers.org/tours/#:~:text=Dampier%20Port%20Tours%20%7C%20Dampier%20-%20Mission,Harvesting%20in%20progress)

Explore the Dampier Archipelago[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)

- **Boat tours:** Operators like **[Lethal Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11v3q63hc4&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAC)** and **Pilbara Dive and Tours** offer guided tours by jet ski or boat to explore the remote beaches, coves, and reefs of the 42 islands. You may see dolphins, turtles, and migratory whales in the waters. **[Archipelago Adventures](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11nmn4dqlz&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAF)** also offers a sunset dinner cruise.
- **Diving and snorkeling:** The archipelago offers world-class diving and snorkeling opportunities, with incredible biodiversity.
- **Fishing:** The Dampier Archipelago is a fishing paradise, home to species such as coral trout, red emperor, and Norwest snapper. You can book a fishing charter with companies like **Old Mate Fishing Adventures**.
- **[Hearson's Cove](https://google.com/viewer/place?mid=/m/0k5mv32&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjXkNCduJORAxUBOfsDHUc3BYkQqdYPegQIBBAL):** This nearby spot is a popular beach for swimming or a sunset picnic. If you visit between March and October, you might witness the "Staircase to the Moon" phenomenon, where the full moon reflects over the exposed tidal flats.[[1]](https://www.australiasnorthwest.com/blog/post/5-things-to-do-in-dampier/)[[2]](https://www.google.com/viewer/place?mid=/g/11qyq39vzf)[[3]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/explore/dampier-archipelago/)[[4]](https://www.westernaustralia.com/en/places/dampier/56b266c22880253d74c4ee8c#:~:text=Accommodation-wise%2C%20there's%20a%20caravan,Sailing%2C%20Snorkelling%2C%20Swimming%2C%20Walks)[[5]](https://www.karrathaiscalling.com.au/activities/fishing-charters/#:~:text=Where%20to%20find%20Fishing%20and,the%20waters%20of%20Western%20Australia.)[[6]](https://www.oldmatesfishingadventures.com.au/#:~:text=Inshore%20Day%20Charter,for%20up%20to%206%20passengers.)
